column4: how can i create binary of a bash script that i have to distribute but i don't want anyone hacking around it?
you cant create a binary of a bash-script, bash script will be interpreted and not compiled

a simple bash script can be read in less, vim, or any editor. Have you install netbeans or java? remember those bin files that take care of all installation and you still can't hack them? a one in all bundled binary.
not possible
as i said bash is interpreted
not for bash scripts? what alernates are there besides doing it all in C?
java is build into classes
python, c, c++
or just use open-source!!!
hmmm, python, that might actually be a good option
closely integrates into out  system and i don't want my devs beeping our servers by playing with it and they will if they can view the code.
security through obscurity is always bad
a system is not safer because you cant read the source-code
agreed, strongly agreed, but for a quick patch i want something, later can get one of sysadmins to limit incoming data
strace your-binary
and i see what it is doing
by the time devs would google and learn about strace, systems would be already fixed :)
sounds like a very strange security-concept
you have to have make harsh and stupid decisions when you aren't just a sysadmin but a manager running short of time.
its always bad if a manager has contact to a system
arguable but offtopic and hence left.
